meanings.definition: Snars (noun): a tangled mass of something
meanings.sent1: The fishing line was a snars of knots and tangles.
meanings.sent2: I tried to comb out the snars in my hair after playing outside.
meanings.sent3: The snars of yarn on the floor looked like a colorful spider web.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a snars of confusion, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The snars of branches in the forest created a natural obstacle course.

meanings.definition: Snars (verb): to become entangled or caught in a snarl
meanings.sent1: The puppy managed to snars its leash around the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: I always seem to snars my headphones in my pocket.
meanings.sent3: The cat snars itself in the curtains while trying to chase a bug.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to snars her in a web of lies.
meanings.sent5: The vines snars around the old fence, creating a natural barrier.
